newsitem.title: USA: Kiwi Int'l gets $5 mln backing from Wasatch.
newsitem.headline: Kiwi Int'l gets $5 mln backing from Wasatch.

text.p: Kiwi International Air Lines secured $5 million in debtor-in-possession financing, which will sustain the bankrupt airline until additional financing is obtained, a company spokesman said.

The $5 million financing commitment from Wasatch Group will "likely to be converted into equity in the final reorganization," Kiwi spokesman Rob Kulat told Reuters following a bankruptcy hearing in Newark.
Bankrutpcy Judge Rosemary Gambardella asked both Wasatch and Kiwi to return Thursday, October 31, to present a more definitive transition plan.
Kiwi said it was too early to determine when it will recall its furloughed employees. Kiwi now has 85 people on payroll, but at its peak, the airline employeed 1,200.

Kiwi filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy reorganization on September 30 under a $40 million debt load and suspended flights on October 15 after failing to secure financing. The carrier's 15-jet fleet remains inactive.
Kiwi's bankruptcy followed its partial shutdown earlier in the year and a general slowing in air passenger traffic after the crash of a ValuJet airliner in May.
The link with Wasatch, which owns Palm Beach Cruise Lines, may provide Kiwi with "some synergies" in the future, Kulat said.
"We still have our charter license and we could service the cruise line," Kulat said.
